> On 9/15/2015 at 6:07 PM, Greenfire32 said:
> 
> 
> I was a life scout, with only 1 merit badge remaining to get eagle (communications) before I quit.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Scouting became less about me having fun with a group of friends and more about my parents and scout leaders giving me lectures and tests for my Eagle.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I told them that lectures and tests were not my idea of after-school fun. They didn't stop pushing homework on me.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I quit. My parents were devastated of course (because I was "right there" as far as earning Eagle goes), but I told them that I was in it for camping, the outdoors, and friends. I wasn't in it for essay's, speeches and written tests. Told them if they would have let me get Eagle on my own, I probably would have, but the constant nagging and prodding totally turned me off scouting.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> However, I have no hurt feelings toward the organization or my fellow scouts (new and old), so if you enjoy scouting, keep at it!
> 

> 
>

*\*takes a deep breath\**

All have been added! Congratulations guys! Glad to see so many scouts in this community! I'm also very excited that I made Eagle, we were really worried I wouldn't make it. We went from first look at paperwork, through project, to turning in paperwork in 4 weeks. Turned it in one day before I turned 18. Definitely cut it close, but I still made it. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") CoH will be in June sometime.

> 
> 
> 24 minutes ago, Endersmens said:
> 
> 
> Wow. Lots of new scouts! I'll be working on the update now. I'm gonna stop with the profile links, since when you call out someone, like [@Dman979](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/123837-dman979/), you can click on the shoutout and it goes to their profile. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") So I'll just use that from now on. Now, to fix formatting...
> 

Thanks ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I would like to mention that between the time of my post that you quoted me on, I earned 2 more merit badges, I also went to NYLT last year ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

Thanks for getting me on the list though ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

I added your NYLT, not sure I wanna keep up with merit badges anymore since everyone will always be getting more badges and that will make more work for me. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:") I might take everyone who's still in progress' merit badges off, and add them once they have either made eagle or quit, that way they won't change. I think that's what I'll do actually. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

You don't seem to have any Canadians yet. I was in Scouts Canada from Beavers through Ventures, and am happy to say I earned my Chief Scout Award (our version of your Eagle Scout).
Well, its pretty much easy to get star and life once you get a leadership position, or [am I wrong?](https://youtu.be/bg1sT4ILG0w?t=29)

I'm a Boy Scout (Life), working on Eagle. Just gotta finish a few Badges and my project - still waiting for a response from the person I emailed. Oh yeah, I'm a former Quartermaster, and current SPL of a troop of 120-ish boys... ASPLs are amazing! And I'm Ordeal rank in OA.
I'm currently a Star Scout and I'm in OA. (I haven't been to the ordeal yet though)

I finally advanced to star scout. Can you update me spot on the list. It's really cool that you maintain this. There aren't a lot of scouts in my area outside of my troop and it's really cool to know that there are indeed plenty out there.
Mind adding me to the list, I'm life, in the process of scheduling my eagle board of review.

Just got back from NYLT. Also only need BoR for Life.

You should all go to NYLT. It's amazing, totally worth it.
